action.action-desc: Ms. Mace introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to increase the penalties related to intentional disclosure of nonconsensual intimate visual depictions, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Responding to Exploitation and Sharing of Private Explicit Content and Threats Act or the RESPECT Act.

section.header: Increased penalties related to intentional disclosure of nonconsensual intimate visual depictions
section.text: Section 223(h) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 223(h)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking 2 years and inserting 5 years; and
in subparagraph (B), by striking 3 years and inserting 10 years; and
in clause (i), by striking 18 months and inserting 3 years; and
in clause (ii), by striking 30 months and inserting 5 years.
